Turnip_description: When you have nothing else, there's always turnips.
AdzukiBean_description: This bean creates a sweet paste when it's mashed.
Agave_description: A cutting of the agave plant which can be used to brew alcohol.
Aloe_description: Aloe has long been an important and indispensable ally for burn care and moisturizing skin care.
Asparagus_description: These hearty shoots are an excellent source of fiber.
Bamboo_description: The shoots of this plant are edible. It grows incredibly quickly.
Barley_description: A dark grain that has a more earthy taste when processed than wheat.
Basil_description: A sweet and fragrant herb, these leaves are used in dishes worldwide.
BayLeaves_description: An herb that has a slightly bitter taste. Adding a leaf or two when cooking enhances other flavors.
BellPepper_description: A large and sweet type of pepper that isn't spicy at all.
BlackBeans_description: A savory bean that's earthy and rich in flavor.
BlackCurrants_description: Dark and juicy berries that can be used for all manner of jams.
BlueAgave_description: A cutting of the agave plant which can be used to brew alcohol.
Buckwheat_description: A more wild kind of wheat, it's somewhat bitter.
ButternutSquash_description: It has a sweet, nutty taste similar to that of a pumpkin.
Cabbage_description: Cabbages are versatile and can be used in salad, pickling, and stews!
CanaryMelon_description: A bright yellow melon, it's distinctively sweet and tangy.
CanolaFlower_description: A flower that can be used to make oil.
Cantaloupe_description: A sweet melon that often tastes great with citrus or salty compliments.
Cassava_description: A hardy tuber from tropical climates, it has a woody flavor.
Catnip_description: The favorite plant of cats the world over.
Celery_description: Crisp and refreshing, it has little inherent taste on its own.
ChickenoftheWoods_description: Sometimes known by its alternative name: sulfur shelf.
Chickpea_description: A coastal staple. Roasted or boiled, they have a slightly nutty and salty taste.
Chives_description: A small relative of the spring onion. It's often used in cooking and has a slightly sweet flavor.
Cilantro_description: The leaves of the coriander plant are called cilantro. It's the flavor of citrus, light and sweet.
CottonBoll_description: Fluffy and white, it can be used to make thread.
Cucumber_description: Cool, crisp, and great for pickles.
CuminSeeds_description: It has a very distinctive flavor with an earthy, nutty, spicy taste. Plant these in fall to grow a cumin plant.
Daikon_description: A large radish that's a favorite for making pickles!
Dill_description: Fresh leaves that have a mildly sharp, green taste with a delicate, sweet crunch.
Durum_description: A hardy pasta that's used to make couscous and authentic pastas.
Elderberries_description: Elderberries have been used for making preserves, wines, and winter cordials.
Enoki_description: Tiny, thin mushrooms that grow in tight bunches.
Fennel_description: A feathery herb that can be eaten as is or cooked.
Fenugreek_description: An annual herb with a favor described as a cross between celery and maple.
Ginseng_description: A hard to find root. It's said to have many health benefits.
Gooseberry_description: A large round berry that makes for tasty pies.
GreenPeas_description: The average green pea. It's not very flavorful on its own.
Groundcherries_description: These tiny tomato-like berries grow inside a leafy shell.
Habanero_description: A popular ingredient in hot sauces and other spicy foods.
HenoftheWoods_description: A leafy mushroom that can be fried or grilled. Sometimes called by its alternative name: maitake.
Honeydew_description: A simple melon that's a popular fruit salad addition.
Jalapeno_description: A moderately spicy pepper. A festive staple.
JuniperBerries_description: Tart and not usually eaten on their own, but they ferment into gin.
KidneyBeans_description: They contain a high amount of phytohemagglutinin which makes them more toxic than other beans.
Lemongrass_description: A grassy kind of plant with a scent and flavor reminiscent of lemons.
Lettuce_description: An essential base for any salad.
LicoriceRoot_description: The natural growing plant that is the flavoring agent in the popular candy.
Marjoram_description: It has complicated flavor notes and can be slightly bitter.
Mint_description: The world's most familiar mint scent is the aroma of peppermint.
NavyBeans_description: A handful of beans. They have a mild flavor.
Oats_description: Associated with lower blood cholesterol and good fiber!
Okra_description: Wet and slimy on the inside, but delicious when fried.
Olive_description: It's packed with vitamins! Olives are used to make oil and salads.
Oregano_description: A warm and aromatic, yet slightly bitter, herb in the mint family.
Parsley_description: A leafy green that is used as an accent in food presentation.
PassionFruit_description: The passion fruit is a pepo, a type of berry, with a juicy interior filled with numerous seeds.
Peanut_description: A tasty nut that can be used to make oil.
Peppercorn_description: Peppery! Perfect for adding a kick to any dish.
PerillaLeaves_description: An herb from far away with a unique scent, often used for cooking.
PintoBeans_description: Eating too many of these beans can produce large amounts of gas!
Quinoa_description: Rich in protein, fiber, B vitamins, and dietary minerals in amounts greater than in many grains.
Raspberry_description: An extremely tart berry that has a warm glow.
Roselle_description: Small, bright red buds. It has a sweet and sour flavor.
Rosemary_description: The smell of rosemary is piney and fresh; familiar but also distinctive.
RoyalFern_description: The young fronds of a fern. They are mild and crisp.
Sage_description: Burned ceremonially to cleanse the spirit and welcome positive thoughts.
Shallot_description: A smaller and milder version of an onion.
Shiitake_description: A strongly flavored mushroom, earthy and bold!
Soybeans_description: Plant in fall to grow a soybean plant, or use this to create tofu and other protein-rich foods.
Spinach_description: He's strong to the finish because he eats his spinach!
SugarBeet_description: This tuber has a high concentration of sucrose. It's good for processing into sugar!
Sugarcane_description: Sugar can be squeezed out of this reedy stalk and made into a refreshing drink.
SweetPotato_description: The nicer cousin of the potato. It's sweet and earthy when baked.
Tarragon_description: Tarragon has a slightly bittersweet flavor. It goes well with fish, meat, soups and stews.
Thyme_description: An aromatic herb in the mint family, with small rounded leaves and pink flowers.
Turmeric_description: Turmeric is mildly aromatic and has scents of orange or ginger. It has a pungent, bitter flavor.
WasabiRoot_description: A root that can be used to make wasabi paste. It has a strong flavor!
Watermelon_description: A huge melon variety from overseas. It has an interesting green color with red insides.
WhiteGrape_description: A different cultivar of grape. It can be used to make sparkling wine.
Wormwood_description: Immensely bitter. It can be used to brew absinthe.
Zucchini_description: A green squash that's wonderful baked or grilled.
TurnipSeeds_description: Plant these in fall. Takes 6 days to mature.
ThymeSeeds_description: Plant these in fall. Takes 5 days to mature.
TurmericSeeds_description: Plant these in fall. Takes 7 days to mature.
WasabiRootSeeds_description: Plant these in summer. Takes 8 days to mature, and grows faster by water.
WatermelonSeeds_description: Plant these in summer. Takes 12 days to mature, with a chance of becoming huge!
WhiteGrapeSeeds_description: Takes 16 days to mature into a bush. Produces grapes every other day in fall.
WormwoodSeeds_description: Plant these in winter. Takes 8 days to mature.
SweetPotatoSeeds_description: Plant these in fall. Takes 8 days to mature.
TarragonSeeds_description: Plant these in fall. Takes 6 days to mature.
RedOnionSeeds_description: Plant these in spring. Takes 8 days to mature.
RoselleSeeds_description: Takes 20 days to mature into a bush. Produces roselle every 4 days in fall.
RosemarySeeds_description: Plant these in fall. Takes 7 days to mature.
RoyalFernSeeds_description: Takes 20 days to mature into a bush. Produces a bounty of royal ferns during the late summer (days 18-24).
SageSeeds_description: Plant these in fall. Takes 5 days to mature.
ShallotSeeds_description: Plant these in spring. Takes 8 days to mature.
ShiitakeSeeds_description: Takes 22 days to mature into a mushroom stump. Produces shiitake every 5 days in spring and fall.
SpinachSeeds_description: Plant these in spring or fall. Takes 4 days to mature. Harvest with a scythe.
SugarBeetSeeds_description: Plant these in spring. Takes 8 days to mature.
SugarcaneSeeds_description: Plant these in summer. Takes 8 days to mature, and grows faster by water. Harvest with a scythe.
PintoBeansSeeds_description: Plant these in spring. Takes 10 days to mature, but keeps producing after that. Grows on a trellis.
QuinoaSeeds_description: Plant these in summer. Takes 6 days to mature.
RaspberrySeeds_description: Takes 14 days to mature into a bush. Produces raspberries throughout raspberry season and a bit longer (Summer 22-28).
JuniperBerriesSeeds_description: Takes 14 days to mature into a bush. Produces juniper berries every 3 days in winter.
KidneyBeansSeeds_description: Plant these in fall. Takes 10 days to mature, but keeps producing after that. Grows on a trellis.
KiwiSeeds_description: Plant these in summer. Takes 21 days to mature, but keeps producing after that. Grows on a trellis.
LemongrassSeeds_description: Plant these in summer. Takes 6 days to mature.
LettuceSeeds_description: Plant these in summer. Takes 6 days to mature.
LicoriceRootSeeds_description: Plant these in spring. Takes 8 days to mature.
PassionFruitSeeds_description: Plant these in spring. Takes 12 days to mature, but keeps producing after that. Grows on a trellis.
MarjoramSeeds_description: Plant these in spring. Takes 6 days to mature.
MintSeeds_description: Plant these in winter. Takes 5 days to mature.
NavyBeansSeeds_description: Plant these in summer. Takes 10 days to mature, but keeps producing after that. Grows on a trellis.
OatsSeeds_description: Plant these in fall. Takes 4 days to mature. Harvest with a scythe.
OkraSeeds_description: Plant these in summer or fall. Takes 10 days to mature, but keeps producing after that.
OliveSeeds_description: Takes 30 days to mature into a bush. Produces olives every day during fall.
OnionSeeds_description: Plant these in spring. Takes 8 days to mature.
OreganoSeeds_description: Plant these in summer. Takes 5 days to mature.
PeanutSeeds_description: Plant these in fall. Takes 20 days to mature.
ParsleySeeds_description: Plant these in spring. Takes 5 days to mature.
PeppercornSeeds_description: Takes 16 days to mature into a bush. Produces peppercorns every 3 days in spring, summer, and fall. No watering necessary!
PerillaLeavesSeeds_description: Plant these in summer. Takes 5 days to mature.
CantaloupeSeeds_description: Plant these in spring. Takes 8 days to mature.
CassavaSeeds_description: Plant these in summer. Takes 7 days to mature.
CatnipSeeds_description: Plant these in spring. Takes 7 days to mature.
CelerySeeds_description: Plant these in fall. Takes 4 days to mature.
ChickenoftheWoodsSeeds_description: Takes 22 days to mature into a mushroom stump. Produces chicken of the woods during the final weeks of summer and fall.
ChickpeaSeeds_description: Plant these in summer. Takes 10 days to mature, and continues to produce after the first harvest.
ChivesSeeds_description: Plant these in summer. Takes 5 days to mature.
CilantroSeeds_description: Seeds with a certain spice to them. Plant in fall to grow cilantro.
CottonBollSeeds_description: Plant these in summer or fall. Takes 8 days to mature, and continues to produce after the first harvest.
CucumberSeeds_description: Plant these in summer. Takes 11 days to mature, but keeps producing after that. Grows on a trellis.
DaikonSeeds_description: Plant these in fall. Takes 8 days to mature.
DillSeeds_description: Plant these in spring. Takes 7 days to mature.
DurumSeeds_description: Plant these in fall. Takes 4 days to mature. Harvest with a scythe.
ElderberriesSeeds_description: Takes 14 days to mature into a bush. Produces elderberries every 4 days in winter.
EnokiSeeds_description: Takes 30 days to mature into a mushroom stump. Produces enoki every 3 days in fall.
FennelSeeds_description: Plant these in fall. Takes 5 days to mature.
FenugreekSeeds_description: Plant these in spring. Takes 5 days to mature.
GinsengSeeds_description: Plant these in spring or winter. Takes 30 days to mature.
GooseberrySeeds_description: Takes 16 days to mature into a bush. Produces gooseberries every 3 days in summer.
GreenPeasSeeds_description: Plant these in summer. Takes 8 days to mature, but keeps producing after that. Grows on a trellis.
GroundcherriesSeeds_description: Plant these in summer or fall. Takes 9 days to mature, and continues to produce after the first harvest.
HabaneroSeeds_description: Plant these in fall. Takes 10 days to mature, and continues to produce after the first harvest.
HenoftheWoodsSeeds_description: Takes 22 days to mature into a mushroom stump. Produces a bounty of hen of the woods during the first week of fall and winter. No watering necessary!
HoneydewSeeds_description: Plant these in summer. Takes 8 days to mature.
JalapenoSeeds_description: Plant these in spring. Takes 8 days to mature, and continues to produce after the first harvest.
BuckwheatSeeds_description: Plant these in spring. Takes 4 days to mature. Harvest with a scythe.
ButternutSquashSeeds_description: Plant these in summer. Takes 10 days to mature, and continues to produce after the first harvest.
CabbageSeeds_description: Plant these in spring. Takes 7 days to mature.
CanaryMelonSeeds_description: Plant these in spring. Takes 12 days to mature, and continues to produce after the first harvest.
CanolaFlowerSeeds_description: Plant in spring or summer. Takes 8 days to produce a flower that can be used to make oil. Harvest with a scythe.
BlackCurrantsSeeds_description: Takes 16 days to mature into a bush. Produces black currants every 3 days in summer.
AdzukiBeanSeeds_description: Plant these in summer. Takes 9 days to mature, and continues to produce after the first harvest.
AgaveSeeds_description: Plant these in spring. Takes 8 days to mature.
AloeSeeds_description: Plant these in summer. Takes 4 days to mature.
AsparagusSeeds_description: Plant these in spring. Takes 5 days to mature.
BambooSeeds_description: Plant these in spring or summer. Takes 9 days to mature.
BarleySeeds_description: Plant these in fall. Takes 4 days to mature. Harvest with a scythe.
BasilSeeds_description: Plant these in spring. Takes 3 days to mature.
BayLeavesSeeds_description: Takes 12 days to mature into a bush. Produces bay leaves every day during winter.
BellPepperSeeds_description: Plant these in summer. Takes 10 days to mature, and continues to produce after the first harvest.
BlackBeansSeeds_description: Plant these in fall. Takes 10 days to mature, and keeps producing after that. Grows on a trellis.
BlueAgaveSeeds_description: Plant these in summer. Takes 12 days to mature.
VanillaSeeds_description: Takes 16 days to mature into a bush. Produces vanilla beans every 3 days in spring. No watering necessary!
ZucchiniSeeds_description: Plant these in fall. Takes 14 days to mature, and continues to produce after the first harvest.
Almond_description: A drupe consisting of an outer hull and a hard shell with the seed within.
Avocado_description: A soft plant that's a popular topping and addition to many meals. It's particular loved by younger generations.
Breadfruit_description: A relative of the jackfruit. It has a robust flavor that is surprisingly fruity and sweet.
CamphorLeaves_description: Glossy oval leaves that are very fragrant when crushed.
Cashew_description: A buttery nut that buds at the bottom of the cashew apple.
ChicleRubber_description: A sticky substance derived from a sapodilla tree. It can be used to make gum.
CinnamonSticks_description: Its scent is uniquely warming, uplifting, and stimulating, and its flavor sweet and delicious.
CocoaPod_description: The pod obtained from a cocoa tree. Mmm! Who's ready to make some chocolate?
DragonFruit_description: Also called a pitaya, this is the fruit of a large cactus.
Durian_description: A smelly fruit with a spiky husk.
EucalyptusLeaves_description: Leathery blue-green leaves are studded with glands containing a fragrant, volatile oil. Luckily not an exploding oil!
Fig_description: A small and sweet fruit polinated by wasps. It's soft and delicious.
Grapefruit_description: A large bitter fruit, high in Vitamin C. Are you a salty or sugary kind of person?
Lemon_description: A tangy citrus fruit that's used to make lemonade.
Lime_description: The tarter cousin of the lemon. It's often used as an accent to numerous dishes.
Lychee_description: A tropical fruit with a unique appearance. Peel them first!
MelaleucaLeaves_description: A prickly cone of leaves that are often used as a homemade remedy for cuts and bruises.
Nectarine_description: A tangy relative of the peach, it's smooth instead of fuzzy.
Nutmeg_description: A fragrant seed that can be ground into a useful spice.
Papaya_description: A tropical fruit from the rainforest. It has a sweet flavor and a lot of natural juiciness.
Pear_description: A mildly sweet fruit that grows in the winter. Let it ripen for a few days before eating.
Pecan_description: A savory nut with a striped seed. Do you own a nutcracker?
Persimmon_description: A somewhat uncommon fruit filled with a honey-like flavor.
Pistachio_description: A versatile and delicious nut that can be eaten as is or used to flavor other products.
Plantain_description: A relative of the banana. It can be starchy.
Pomelo_description: A really large, not so bitter, cousin of the grapefruit.
Ume_description: A type of plum that can be eaten fresh or pickled!
Vanilla_description: Easily one of the most well-known flavors in the world. Who’s hungry for ice cream?
Walnut_description: A nut that makes delicious candies and pies. It's often used in the filling of sweet treats.
Yuzu_description: A citrus fruit that's related to the lemon, but sweeter.
Sapodilla_description: This fruit has a rich, brown sugar taste to it.
AlmondSapling_description: Takes 28 days to produce a mature Almond tree. Ready to harvest in the fall. Only grows if the 8 surrounding "tiles" are empty.
AvocadoSapling_description: Takes 28 days to produce a mature Avocado tree. Bears fruit in the summer. Only grows if the 8 surrounding "tiles" are empty.
BreadfruitSapling_description: Takes 28 days to produce a mature Breadfruit tree. Bears fruit in the spring. Only grows if the 8 surrounding "tiles" are empty.
CamphorLeavesSapling_description: Takes 28 days to produce a mature Camphor tree. Ready to harvest in the winter. Only grows if the 8 surrounding "tiles" are empty.
CashewSapling_description: Takes 28 days to produce a mature Cashew tree. Ready to harvest in the fall. Only grows if the 8 surrounding "tiles" are empty.
SapodillaSeed_description: This can be planted to grow a sapodilla tree.
CinnamonSticksSapling_description: Takes 28 days to produce a mature Cinnamon tree. Ready to harvest in the winter. Only grows if the 8 surrounding "tiles" are empty.
CocoaPodSapling_description: Takes 28 days to produce a mature Cocoa tree.  Ready to harvest in the spring. Only grows if the 8 surrounding "tiles" are empty.
DragonFruitSapling_description: Takes 28 days to produce a mature Dragon Fruit tree. Bears fruit in the summer. Only grows if the 8 surrounding "tiles" are empty.
DurianSapling_description: Takes 28 days to produce a mature Durian tree. Bears fruit in the summer. Only grows if the 8 surrounding "tiles" are empty.
EucalyptusLeavesSapling_description: Takes 28 days to produce a mature Eucalyptus tree. Ready to harvest in the spring. Only grows if the 8 surrounding "tiles" are empty.
FigSapling_description: Takes 28 days to produce a mature Fig tree. Bears fruit in the winter. Only grows if the 8 surrounding "tiles" are empty.
GrapefruitSapling_description: Takes 28 days to produce a mature Grapefruit tree. Bears fruit in the fall. Only grows if the 8 surrounding "tiles" are empty.
LemonSapling_description: Takes 28 days to produce a mature Lemon tree. Bears fruit in the spring. Only grows if the 8 surrounding "tiles" are empty.
LimeSapling_description: Takes 28 days to produce a mature Lime tree. Bears fruit in the spring. Only grows if the 8 surrounding "tiles" are empty.
LycheeSapling_description: Takes 28 days to produce a mature Lychee tree. Bears fruit in the summer. Only grows if the 8 surrounding tiles are empty.
MelaleucaLeavesSapling_description: Takes 28 days to produce a mature Melaleuca tree. Ready to harvest in the spring. Only grows if the 8 surrounding "tiles" are empty.
NectarineSapling_description: Takes 28 days to produce a mature Nectarine tree. Bears fruit in the summer. Only grows if the 8 surrounding "tiles" are empty.
NutmegSapling_description: Takes 28 days to produce a mature Nutmeg tree. Ready to harvest in the summer. Only grows if the 8 surrounding tiles are empty.
PapayaSapling_description: Takes 28 days to produce a mature Papaya tree. Bears fruit in the summer. Only grows if the 8 surrounding "tiles" are empty.
PearSapling_description: Takes 28 days to produce a mature Pear tree. Bears fruit in the winter. Only grows if the 8 surrounding "tiles" are empty.
PecanSapling_description: Takes 28 days to produce a mature Pecan tree. Ready to harvest in the fall. Only grows if the 8 surrounding "tiles" are empty.
PersimmonSapling_description: Takes 28 days to produce a mature Persimmon tree. Bears fruit in the winter. Only grows if the 8 surrounding "tiles" are empty.
PistachioSapling_description: Takes 28 days to produce a mature Pistachio tree. Ready to harvest in the fall. Only grows if the 8 surrounding tiles are empty.
PlantainSapling_description: Takes 28 days to produce a mature Plantain tree. Bears fruit in the summer, or all year round when planted on Ginger Island.
PomeloSapling_description: Takes 28 days to produce a mature Pomelo tree. Bears fruit in the fall. Only grows if the 8 surrounding "tiles" are empty.
UmeSapling_description: Takes 28 days to produce a mature Ume tree. Bears fruit in the summer. Only grows if the 8 surrounding tiles are empty.
WalnutSapling_description: Takes 28 days to produce a mature Walnut tree. Ready to harvest in the fall. Only grows if the 8 surrounding "tiles" are empty.
YuzuSapling_description: Takes 28 days to produce a mature Yuzu tree. Bears fruit in the winter. Only grows if the 8 surrounding tiles are empty.
OliveOil_description: A light vegetable oil often used for salads.
BuckwheatFlour_description: A cooking ingredient made from crushed buckwheat.
SemolinaFlour_description: A cooking ingredient made from milled durum.
TapiocaFlour_description: A cooking ingredient made from crushed cassava.
GrapeSeeds_description: Takes 16 days to mature into a bush. Produces grapes every other day in fall.
WhiteGrapeSeeds_description2: Plant these in fall. Takes 8 days to mature, and continues to produce after the first harvest. Grows on a trellis.
Mail_PierreY1WinterCrops: Hi @,^I just wanted to let you know that even though it's winter, there are still a few things you can grow. Come check out what's in stock or plant a sapling to grow for the coming new year!^-Pierre[#]Winter Crops Available
Mail_MarnieY2Herbs: Hi @,^It's the start of a new year and I thought I would let you know that I have a new kind of tree in stock. It has a very pleasant smell and I have found that my animals are calmed by it. Please come by and check out the stock when you have a chance!^-Marnie[#]New Sapling Available
Mail_JojaY1WinterCrops: To our valued JojaMart customers: We now have new winter crops in stock. Come see what's in store for you!^^-Morris^Joja Customer Satisfaction Representative[#]Joja Winter Crops Available
Press_description: Turns milk into cheese and soybeans into tofu.
SesameSeeds_description: Seeds with a smoky flavor. Plant in summer to grow a sesame plant.
SesameOil_description: A bottle of oil made from sesame seeds.
Tofu_description: Made from soybean milk. Can be used as a source of protein in many recipes.
Molasses_description: The sticky by-product of milling sugar.
WholeGrainFlour_description: A cooking ingredient made from whole kernels of grain.
